headline: Banana Oat Muffins
description: These oatmeal banana muffins make a deliciously sweet, healthy breakfast and are made with bananas and rolled oats. They're a tasty grab-and-go treat.

video.description: These muffins are a quick, easy treat for breakfast any day.
video.name: Banana Oat Muffins

name: Banana Oat Muffins

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). Line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners.
Combine flour, oats, sugar, baking powder, soda, and salt in a medium bowl; set aside.

Beat egg lightly in a large bowl. Whisk in milk, oil, and vanilla. Stir in mashed bananas. Add the flour mixture and stir until just combined. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full.
Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, 18 to 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I gave it a go. I like others though the muffins are a bit tasteless as we are in general used to baking with higher sugar amounts. I did add 2/3 cup chopped walnuts to bring the flavour up. Friendly critique.😊 Perhaps the muffins were dryer, as I didn’t use refined oatmeal. Thank you for sharing your muffin!
Disappointing. I made the for a girls breakfast. Although they were moist, they were very bland. Not enough sugar or flavor. Will not use this recipe again.
Amazing! Used it a couple of times and they always bake perfectly. Will totally recommend
Super easy and yummy! We also used 1:1 gluten free flour as a replacement.
I am not a baker and these were so great even with my add ins! Thank you!
So bad. Literally had no flavor. I even added a light powdered sugar glaze and a cinnamon/sugar dusting on top. Still threw them away. Don't bother.
Delicious and moist! Not overly sweet like the traditional recipes I have used in the past. I added about 3/4 cup of mini semi sweet chocolate chips to the batter and they came out perfect.
Super yummy! Added some cinnamon and nutmeg to the mix and they came out perfect!
It went out well. Fluffy, sweet, fragant. But I used brown sugar in place of white since it was all I have. Added chia and cacao nibs as well since I have them.

Love these muffins. I especially like that the recipe doesn't call for a lot of sugar. They're little fluffy clouds :) I made mine with Kefir instead of milk and I added a few raisins and chopped walnuts. Yum!
I like this recipe and it is so yummy thanks for let me know about the recipe
Picky 11 year old going through a growth spurt loves them! Easy to make as well!

I didn't find them to have very much flavor. And I used three bananas! Plus I added a tablespoon of sugar as many suggested but quite honestly I would definitely not make this again. Don't waste your time.

These were good, nice easy quick grab n go breakfast. I made a second batch with a couple adjustments for my diet. Instead of white flour I used wheat, I did use sugar substitute and used avacado oil and a teaspoon of cinnamon.
This is a great, simple recipe that is delicious. I used all purpose Gluten Free flour and added 1/4 cup of mini chocolate chips. Yum!
Delicious! We used everything organic and added chocolate chips.

Delicious! I did recommended sugar/brown sugar combo and actually used 2 cups of mashed bananas because I had to use them. I also added walnuts. Made 24 muffins. Loved the idea of the ice cream scoop as it made filling so easy. Thanks so much for this easy, moist recipe!

Very good, not too sweet. I added a squirt of Agave syrup to the wet batter and it was just perfect for me, perhaps even the oats helped regulate glucose, along with the fiber in the bananas., but ANY sweet bread I make make my face skin "crawl" anytime something is too sugary or salty. (I think is from my MS infusions causing that) but these I have ZERO that happen with these!:(, will def put this on my rotation and recipe book!
Love these! Add applesauce instead of oil to maintain moisture and add flavor, and use half brown half white sugar.

Followed most of the recipe and was pleased with the results. I made these changes: used turbinado sugar, added a tablespoon of raw honey, added mini semi-sweet chocolate chips and 1/3 cup chopped walnuts. Next I will reduce the oil by 1 or 2 tablespoons, and omit the chocolate chips. Overall moist, good chewiness from the oatmeal, banana flavor was good but not overpowering. Good solid breakfast muffin. Definitely making this again.
Fantastic recipe I put brown sugar in mine
I used olive oil instead of canola and I increased vanilla to 1 t.
These were simple to make and delicious to eat thank you

Loved them, I just used what I had in my kitchen so added macadamia nuts, sunflower seeds, and one grated squash. I should have sprayed the paper cups, and they were a little extra moist, but overall so delicious! I will make them again with whatever is in my kitchen.
I used kefir instead of milk. Delicious:)

Loved it. Not too sweet, which is great in its own way. I was still happy with it. The second time around I made it with double the sugar & extra banana…yet I still think I could triple the sugar and they still won’t be too sweet. Definitely plan to triple the sugar/banana for the third time I make it. My family loved it as well from my parents to the babies
Great recipe - very straight forward - added 1/2 cup chocolate chips to it - I'm sure that makes it even healthier :-)

I think this is the best banana muffin recipe I've made by far. In reading about how ingredients work in a recipe, butter at room temperature, whipped until light yellow with the eggs and the sugar make for a light and fluffy muffin (a light and fluffy anything - for that matter). Plus, you can't go wrong with butter as your fat. The taste is far superior to any other fat you can use. The muffin is great alone, with cream cheese icing, or a beautiful butter icing. Definitely a family favorite. They don't last long. I like to bake them in silicone molds, just to make them that much more appealing ;)
Big hit with the family. Very small variation: used 2 bananas (didn't measure) and added a cup of blueberries. Per someone's suggestion I set oven at 375 for 20ish minutes.
Loved these! Delicious! Very easy and quick to make. I used avocado oil as that’s all I had on hand they still tasted great!
Delicious with and without chocolate chips!
Tomorrow I am making more and adding blueberries.
Good recipe. I always read the others notes. Used half brown and half organic sugar, cinnamon, and 1/2 cup roughly chopped walnuts (because I like walnuts).

Easy easy directions. I buzzed up the oats for about a minute before adding it to the dry mix. 
Doubled the recipe and it was even using an ice cream scoop with the thumb spring.
Quick,easy,tastes good,nice tecture
This is great

These are my “go to” muffins! I’ve been making these for years. Instead of the oil, I use the (single serving) applesauce (sometimes cinnamon applesauce). Since I’m vegan, I use a flaxseed egg instead of regular egg. I also add chocolate chips. Everyone loves them!
I really liked this recipe, its so nice en these are the best muffins have ever made. I will make them any time possible. I added some cinnamon and raisins en these were da best. Thumbs up men
Moist, just the right amount of chewy, recipe worked as-is at 7K ft.
Sub with coconut sugar and whole wheat flour. Timing and temp are off. Need to try lower for longer

These are really good!

Substitutions/modifications I made:
- I can't have gluten so I subbed 1/2 cup almond flour and 1 1/4 cups oat flour in place of the regular flour.
- Added some cinnamon!
- Used Swerve sugar replacement instead of the white sugar.
- Split the batter among 24 muffins.
Great for breakfast and budget-concious-and-diet-conscious girl like me. I used 'chia egg' and brown sugar for this recipe. The result is sweet and full to the stomach. Love it!

I love this recipe but made some changes:
- 1/3 cup of maple syrup instead of sugar
- subbed the vegetable oil for coconut oil which made the muffins super moist
- added some chocolate chips and crushed walnuts
- subbed the milk for almond milk which also helped moisten the muffins
Will continue using this recipe with these modifications!
Pretty good, i halved the sugar cos i wanted to give them to my toddler as a snack and i added bluberries coated in flour to half as well for some variation. Would make again. No complaints.

I've made it twice now. First time I added walnuts to half of the batch. I found that made them not only more tasty but also added extra nutritional value. 
Second batch I added walnuts to all. As well as mini chocolate chips. It's important to not over bake.

Made exactly as written. I wanted the fat, because I am a one person household and needed to have them last a few days. Loved these muffins and will make them again. So easy to make, with ingredients I always have on hand. Great way to use up bananas that have turned into baking bananas.
added some chocolate chips and it was perfect
Delish! I only had Quaker instant oatmeal packs. Used 3 maple sugar packages and cut the sugar in have. Added nutmeg and cinnamon. So good!
I added blueberries. YUM! We loved them

Came out beautifully. I do however think they are a bit bland without something added to them. Chocolate chips or nuts or coconut would make them super tasty. I think even using this as a base for mixed berry muffins is something I'm gong to try next time I have over ripe bananas.
Reduced sugar to 1/4 cup and substituted brown sugar. Reduced oil to 1/4 cup. Added powdered ginger and cinnamon or nutmeg. Added currants and/or mini chocolate chips. Makes 12 medium sized muffins

Great recipe for a non cook! Have made these multiple times for breakfast. I add blueberries in the middle and on top for each muffin. I also do as other people suggest and use half whole wheat flour, applesauce for the oil and brown sugar instead of white. I also add a tsp of cinnamon. Delicious and very moist.
We enjoyed them. They are not very sweet, but probably healthier that way!
Substituted oat flour for wheat flour and oat milk instead of cow's milk. Substituted coconut oil instead of vegetable oil. Real delicious, super hit!!

Very good and a huge hit with the kids! I made this recipe almost exactly as described, except I used oat milk instead of regular milk. I doubled the recipe using the adjustment tool, and it made a ton! I ended up with 28 standard size muffins, and 24 mini muffins! I gave it 4 stars because I did feel like the recipe needs some added flavors, but is a good basic recipe. I dropped in a few chocolate chips to some and blueberries to others after I divided the batter. With the remaining batter I had left, I added cinnamon and raisins. Next time, I think I will do as others suggest and use 1/2 white and brown sugar, and keep the cinnamon and mix-ins.
I love this recipe. I add cranberries to it and bake it in muffin top molds. We call them cranberry rounds. Yum!
Been trying 3rd time with different recipe and finally made it!! Love the taste and texture! Thanks!!

I made these for breakfast this morning as I wanted to use up 2 over riped bananas . This is the first time ever I made muffins from the scratch. I added semi sweet chocolate chips 1/4 cup and sprinkled walnuts on top and baked them. They turned out soooo delicious , dense and moist and perfect level of sweetness. I did share the muffins with my friends they loved it too. This is going in my recipe book permanently. Thank you so much for the great recipe.
I didn't have enough banana, so I added frozen berries (thawed so I could drain the liquid) to make up the difference. Beautiful and delicious!

Love this recipe! 
Great breakfast muffin. 
However I did make some adjustments. 
I added 1/2 cup of raisins, a full cup of chopped pecans, and an additional cup of oatmeal. 
The outcome was a denser muffin which is what I was wanting. 
My husband wants more raisins next time. I am also going to try a keto wheat flour and a tropical mueslis. 
Fun experimenting!
We love this muffin recipe. I make it often, just as the recipe is written.
doubled the recipe and had 5 banana. very moist.

I love this. I replaced milk with almond milk and a tbsp of heavy cream, used 2/3 parts whole wheat flour, And replaced the oil with applesauce. I also used Swerve brown sugar for the sugar and it came out yummy. Needs a bit more sugar but otherwise it’s perfect!
1/4c sugar, 1/2c pecans, 1/2c + dark chocolate chips
Delicious and easy to make. The family loved it!

The best muffins I have ever made, hands down. And I’ve been making muffins for over 35 years. The only two changes I made were to soak the oats in milk and then add to wet ingredients and I used brown sugar instead of white. I can’t get over how good these are!
Turned out well. I recommend adding more banana than it says and adding something like raisins or chocolate chips for more flavour. My only complaint was they were a little dry.

Haven’t tasted these bad boys yet but they smell delicious. I used very ripe and just over ripe bananas. No changes to original recipe except for using grape seed oil, I like that flavor. Will try after they cool a bit.
Excellent. Used all measurement with a couple adds. Used 3 very ripe bananas, added walnuts and topped with a sprinkle of brown sugar & oats.

I took some suggestions below. I doubled the recipe, Substituted apple sauce for the oil. Used 1/2 brown sugar - 1/2 White sugar. Used 3 eggs. And used my frozen Bananas I had waiting to use up (ended up being 6 frozen (Thawed n mashed) bananas to make the 2 cups required) I added a pinch of cinnamon, and chocolate chips. Turned out amazing!! Perfectly moist.

I love this recipe. Super easy and fast, and I follow all the instructions the way the recipe says with only one optional addition: add a cup of blueberries. When I want to get wild, I sometimes sprinkle sugar on top. They turn out moist and delicious, and they can be stored in the refrigerator for a long time. Not sure if these are "healthy," but definitely a healthier use of those brown bananas than, say, banana cake. :)
Delicious & easy to make!
Added walnuts and chocolate chips and reduced sugar in recipe.
Really good. I added chocolate chips and used applesauce instead of oil but they were a little too moist.
Good!
Very good muffins! I added 1 Apple for moisture after reading some comments. Would make again.

Hmmm...jury’s out with this recipe. It was easy to make. No issues but like some reviewers said, it does taste of too much baking powder. I did add 1/2 cup of raisins, powdered ginger and nutmeg to the flour mixture. I reduced the sugar to 1/4 cup of dark brown sugar. Used fat free milk. Baked beautifully. Without the raisins and the added spices for me, this would be have been too bland and baking powder-y. I will make this again but cut the baking powder to 1 tsp
Added 10 choc chips in each cup between 2 scoops of batter

Wonderful recipe! These muffins turned out very moist and flavorful, although I did make some adjustments. I substituted a third of the flour with whole wheat, and used a quarter cup brown sugar along with a quarter cup maple syrup. Some said their muffins were turning out dry, so I baked for 20 minutes at 375, and, as hoped, they turned out very moist. All in all, I would definetly reccomend this recipe.
|My Hubby loves it!
Flavourless with too much baking soda taste, dry, texture too oats.
I had my grandson make them as part of his science class, they turned out great. Very moist and flavorful.

I replaced the sugar with 1/2 Splenda & 1/2 Splenda brown sugar
added 1Tbs honey, used almond milk audio added 
1/2teaspoon nutmeg add & 1 tsp cinnamon (for a batch of 6)
Ave replaced oil with coconut oil oh was added a few crushed mixed nuts!
They were amazing!!!
Love this recipe!! It’s one of my go-to muffin Recipes. I added chocolate chips to it this last time to make it fun but it’s great as is!
Doubled the vanilla. Loved these! Thanks for sharing!!

If I could give this 0 stars, I would! I followed the recipe as it was written, and the flavour was so gross. It tastes sour 
I’ll stick to my full-fat, unhealthy banana bread next time because at least it tastes good

I made them and I found them a lil too salty and could taste the baking powder & baking soda. I recommend decreasing baking soda and powder and little less salt but hey my teen gamer loved them like all teens
These were delicious. Nice little snack.

I am reviewing the actual recipe and not any changes I made to it. The recipe was a good base and very moist however it was not sweet enough. I used 3 bananas and 1/2 cup brown sugar. Next time I will try 3/4 sugar

I added only 3/4 cup oats along with 3/4 cup peanut butter flavoured chocolate chips. Baking time was too low for me - we baked for 23 minutes. We made 18 muffins because the muffin tins looked full - but turns out they didn't rise as much as I was expecting. So we had 18 small muffins. Moist and delicious!

Used half whole wheat flour and half coconut oil, added a scant teaspoon of cinnamon and sprinkle of nutmeg. They're good, will probably make again, but still on the lookout for banana nut muffins that rival Sam's Club.
Added walnuts, turned out amazing!

I substituted the sugar for 1/4 cup honey and also the oil for coconut oil. I made them with gluten free all purpose flour as well. They turned out very good! The only part I don’t like is the chewiness in the oats. My husband loved them though and I will definitely use this recipe again.
These turned out great!!
Added 1/2 cup brown sugar for a sweeter muffin.

I found it cooked quicker than the instructions. Could've cooked it lower temp or cut the time to 15min maybe. They also puffed up quite a bit so cups filled abit to much by spliting the batter between 12 cups. Crispy on outside soft in middle. I used 4 bananas and not s very strong banana flavor. By far not the best recipe I've done

Have enjoyed this from the first time I made them and now that we are staying inside they have become a staple with bananas that are ripening fast. I make 18 muffins by adding to the recipe a 1/2 Cup of Unsweetened Applesauce; eliminating 2 TBSPS of sugar, and just sprinkling ground cinnamon on top. They are quick, easy, delicious, and nutritious...what else can one ask for in a recipe?

We loved these! The only thing I changed was substituting applesauce for oil. They puffed up nicely and were a nice golden brown. This is probably one of my favorite muffin recipes that I've made. We will definitely make again! The only thing I would do differently is skip the paper liners as you lose a part of the muffin trying to get them out.

Yummy recipe as is! 

I added half a cup extra of oats, as well as half a cup of PBfit protein powder. I added about half a teaspoon extra of baking soda to leaven. 

To combat the extra dry ingredients I added an extra banana and a splash of milk.

The topping as seen in the picture is just sugar, oats, and cinnamon. I’d recommend adding a streusel type oat topping for extra yummy goodness!

Makes a great snack and a healthy dessert alternative.
